turns.content: I'm looking for some advice on organizing my closet. I just got back from the mall today and I have some new additions to add to my collection, I picked up a pair of boots and a sweater from Macy's during their Black Friday sale, and I'm not sure where to put them.

Congratulations on your new purchases! Organizing your closet can be a daunting task, but with a few simple steps, you can create a space that's functional, stylish, and makes you feel great. Here are some tips to help you incorporate your new boots and sweater into your closet:

1. **Purge before you organize**: Before adding new items, take everything out of your closet and sort items into three piles: keep, donate/sell, and discard. Get rid of anything that's no longer worn, ill-fitting, or in poor condition. This will help you declutter and make room for your new additions.
2. **Categorize and group similar items together**: Divide your closet into sections based on categories, such as tops, bottoms, dresses, outerwear, and accessories. Within each section, group similar items together (e.g., all sweaters, all boots). This makes it easier to find what you need and prevents clutter from building up in the future.
3. **Assign a home for each item**: Once you've grouped similar items together, assign a specific spot for each item. For example, designate a shelf or section for your sweaters, and a specific area for your boots. This will help maintain order and make it easier to find what you need.
4. **Use storage containers and bins**: Use bins, baskets, or shelves to store items that are out of season or less frequently worn. Label each container so you can easily identify what's inside. This will help keep your closet floor and shelves clutter-free.
5. **Utilize vertical space**: Maximize your closet's vertical space by using stackable shelves or hanging rods with multiple levels. This will help you make the most of your closet's space and keep your floor clear.
6. **Hang clothes by type**: Hang clothes in a logical order, such as dresses, tops, pants, and skirts. Within each category, organize items by type, color, or season. For example, hang all your sweaters together, followed by your tops, and so on.
7. **Store out-of-season items**: Consider storing out-of-season clothes in containers or bins and keeping them on a high shelf or in a separate area of your closet. This will help declutter your main closet space and make room for your current wardrobe.

For your new boots, you can:

* Store them on a boot rack or a shelf specifically designed for boots.
* Place them in a protective boot bag or dust bag to keep them clean and dust-free.
* Consider storing them on the floor of your closet, but make sure they're not blocking other items or creating a tripping hazard.

For your new sweater, you can:

* Hang it on a sweater organizer or a velvet hanger to prevent stretching or creasing.
* Fold it and store it on a shelf or in a drawer, using a drawer divider or bin to keep it organized.
* Consider storing it in a breathable, cloth bag to keep it clean and protected.

Remember, the key to a well-organized closet is to create a system that works for you and your lifestyle. Experiment with different layouts and storage solutions until you find one that makes you feel happy and relaxed in your closet.

I like those tips! I'll definitely try to implement them. By the way, I did manage to snag a good deal on those boots, they were originally $150 but I got them for $90 with a 40% discount. And the sweater was on sale for 20% off, it was $40 instead of $50. Do you have any advice on how to keep track of my purchases and stay within my budget?

Congratulations on scoring those deals! You're already a savvy shopper!

Tracking your purchases and staying within your budget are crucial skills to master. Here are some tips to help you do just that:

1. **Create a budget**: Set a realistic budget for yourself, and allocate a specific amount for clothing and accessories each month. You can use the 50/30/20 rule as a starting point: 50% for necessities, 30% for discretionary spending, and 20% for saving and debt repayment.
2. **Use a budgeting app**: There are many budgeting apps available, such as Mint, Personal Capital, or YNAB (You Need a Budget). These apps can help you track your income, expenses, and stay within your budget.
3. **Keep a purchase log**: Keep a spreadsheet or a notebook to log each purchase, including the item, price, and date. This will help you track your spending and identify areas where you can cut back.
4. **Set a "30-day rule"**: When you see something you want to buy, wait 30 days before making the purchase. This can help you determine if the item is something you truly need or just a impulse buy.
5. **Use cashback and rewards**: Use cashback credit cards or sign up for rewards programs that offer points or discounts on your purchases. This can help you earn money back or accumulate points that can be redeemed for future purchases.
6. **Avoid impulse buys**: Try to avoid buying items on impulse, especially if they're not on sale or within your budget. Take time to think about whether you really need the item and if it's worth the cost.
7. **Shop during sales**: Plan your shopping trips during sales periods, like Black Friday, and look for discounts, coupons, or promo codes that can help you save money.
8. **Consider a "one in, one out" policy**: For every new item you bring into your closet, consider getting rid of an old one to maintain a balanced wardrobe and prevent clutter.

To track your purchases, you can use a simple spreadsheet or a budgeting app. Here's a template to get you started:

| Date | Item | Original Price | Discount | Final Price | Category |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 11/27 | Boots | $150 | 40% | $90 | Shoes |
| 11/27 | Sweater | $50 | 20% | $40 | Tops |

By tracking your purchases and staying within your budget, you'll be able to make more intentional buying decisions and avoid overspending.

Remember, it's all about being mindful of your spending habits and making conscious choices that align with your financial goals. Happy shopping (and budgeting)!

That's really helpful! I'll definitely start using a budgeting app and tracking my purchases. Speaking of which, I also recently bought some skincare items during Sephora's VIB sale, and I got a few other items on sale at Target and Nordstrom Rack. Do you have any advice on how to organize my skincare routine and keep track of when to repurchase products?

You're on a roll with those sales! Organizing your skincare routine and keeping track of product usage can be a challenge, but with a few simple systems, you'll be a pro in no time!

Here are some tips to help you organize your skincare routine and keep track of your products:

1. **Categorize your products**: Group your skincare products into categories, such as:
	* Cleansers
	* Toners
	* Essences
	* Serums
	* Moisturizers
	* Exfoliants
	* Masks
	* Eye care
2. **Create a skincare routine chart**: Create a chart or diagram to visualize your daily skincare routine. This will help you remember the order of products and ensure you're using them correctly.
3. **Use a product tracker**: Keep a spreadsheet, notebook, or use an app like Skincare.com's Product Tracker to log:
	* Product name
	* Purchase date
	* Expiration date (if applicable)
	* Usage frequency (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly)
	* Notes (e.g., how it's working, any issues)
4. **Organize your products**: Store your products in a designated area, such as a skincare cabinet, drawer, or on a countertop organizer. Group similar products together, and consider using small baskets or containers to separate items.
5. **Implement a "first in, first out" policy**: Use the oldest products first to ensure you're not keeping expired or stagnant products.
6. **Set reminders**: Set reminders on your calendar or phone to:
	* Check product expiration dates
	* Repurchase products when they're running low
	* Review your skincare routine and adjust as needed
7. **Take progress photos**: Take regular photos of your skin to track progress, identify areas for improvement, and adjust your routine accordingly.
8. **Keep product information handy**: Keep product instructions, ingredient lists, and packaging in a designated folder or binder for easy reference.

For your recent purchases, make sure to log them in your product tracker and update your skincare routine chart accordingly. This will help you stay organized and ensure you're using your new products effectively.

Remember, the key to an effective skincare routine is consistency and patience. By tracking your products and routine, you'll be able to identify what's working for your skin and make adjustments as needed.

Happy skincare journeying!

I'm glad you found those tips helpful! I've been trying to cut back on shopping and focus on saving money, but it's hard to resist a good deal. Speaking of which, I also found a great deal on a handbag at a garage sale a month ago, it was only $10! And I got a pair of sunglasses for $5. Do you have any advice on how to organize my accessories, like handbags and sunglasses, and keep them from getting cluttered?

You're a savvy shopper, aren't you? Finding great deals on accessories can be thrilling, but it's essential to keep them organized to ensure they remain functional and enjoyable. Here are some tips to help you organize your handbags and sunglasses:

**Handbag Organization:**

1. **Designate a handbag station**: Choose a specific area, like a closet shelf or a storage ottoman, to store your handbags.
2. **Use a handbag organizer**: Invest in a handbag organizer or a storage cube to keep your bags upright and prevent them from getting crushed or creased.
3. **Store out-of-season bags**: Consider storing out-of-season handbags in a storage bin or container to free up space and reduce clutter.
4. **Group similar bags together**: Organize your handbags by type (e.g., totes, shoulder bags, clutches) or by occasion (e.g., work, casual, formal).
5. **Hang bags with hooks**: Use hooks or a handbag hanger to store bags with straps or handles, keeping them organized and easy to access.

**Sunglasses Organization:**

1. **Use a sunglasses case**: Store each pair of sunglasses in a protective case to prevent scratches and damage.
2. **Designate a sunglasses spot**: Choose a specific area, like a tray or dish near your entrance, to store your sunglasses.
3. **Organize by type**: Group your sunglasses by type (e.g., aviators, wayfarers, reading glasses) or by occasion (e.g., everyday, sports, fashion).
4. **Use a sunglasses tree**: Consider using a sunglasses tree or stand to store multiple pairs, keeping them organized and easily accessible.

**General Accessory Organization Tips:**

1. **Purge regularly**: Regularly go through your accessories and remove any items that are broken, out of style, or no longer used.
2. **Keep frequently used items accessible**: Store your most frequently used accessories in easy-to-reach locations, making it simple to grab them on the go.
3. **Use storage containers**: Use storage bins, baskets, or containers to store smaller accessories like scarves, hats, or belts, keeping them organized and out of sight.
4. **Label your storage**: Label your storage containers or areas to ensure you can quickly find what you need.
5. **Keep accessories clean and maintained**: Regularly clean and maintain your accessories to prevent damage and extend their lifespan.

By implementing these tips, you'll be able to enjoy your accessories while keeping them organized and clutter-free. Remember, the key is to create a system that works for you and your lifestyle.

Now, go enjoy your new handbag and sunglasses, and happy organizing!

I'm glad you found those tips helpful! I think I'll start implementing some of those ideas for my own accessories. By the way, I also got a few clothing items recently, including a dress and trousers from Banana Republic during their friends and family sale. Do you have any advice on how to organize my clothes and keep them from getting wrinkled or damaged?

You're on a roll with those sales! Congratulations on your new purchases! Organizing your clothes can be a challenge, but with a few simple tips, you can keep them looking their best and prevent wrinkles and damage. Here are some ideas to get you started:

**Clothing Organization Tips:**

1. **Categorize and group similar items**: Organize your clothes by type (e.g., tops, bottoms, dresses, outerwear) and then group similar items together (e.g., all dresses, all trousers).
2. **Use a color-coded system**: Organize your clothes by color to create a visually pleasing and easy-to-navigate closet. This can also help you identify gaps in your wardrobe and plan outfits.
3. **Invest in quality hangers**: Use sturdy, velvet-covered hangers to prevent clothes from slipping off and to reduce creasing.
4. **Hang clothes by type**: Hang clothes in a logical order, such as dresses, tops, pants, and skirts. Within each category, organize items by type, color, or season.
5. **Use storage bins and baskets**: Store out-of-season clothes or items that are not frequently worn in storage bins or baskets to keep them clean and dust-free.
6. **Fold clothes properly**: Fold clothes like a pro by using the KonMari fold or another technique that works for you. This will help prevent wrinkles and creases.
7. **Store delicate items separately**: Store delicate or special-care items, like lingerie or silk garments, separately to prevent damage.
8. **Keep shoes in order**: Store shoes in a designated area, like a shoe rack or on a shelf, to keep them organized and prevent them from getting scattered throughout your closet.

**Preventing Wrinkles and Damage:**

1. **Hang clothes as soon as possible**: Hang clothes immediately after they come out of the dryer to prevent wrinkles from setting in.
2. **Use a steamer**: Invest in a steamer to quickly remove wrinkles and creases from clothes without damaging them.
3. **Avoid overcrowding**: Don't overcrowd your closet or storage bins, as this can cause clothes to wrinkle or become damaged.
4. **Use cloth bags or cloth storage**: Store clothes in cloth bags or cloth storage containers to prevent damage from dust, moths, or pests.
5. **Check on stored clothes regularly**: Regularly check on stored clothes to ensure they're not developing wrinkles, creases, or damage.

By implementing these tips, you'll be able to keep your clothes organized, prevent wrinkles and damage, and make the most of your wardrobe.

Now, go enjoy your new dress and trousers, and happy organizing!

I think I'll try using a color-coded system to organize my clothes. That sounds like a great way to make my closet look more visually pleasing and make it easier to find what I need. I'll also make sure to invest in some quality hangers and storage bins to keep my clothes organized and protected. Thanks for the advice!

You're welcome! I'm thrilled to hear that you're excited to try out a color-coded system and invest in quality hangers and storage bins. These small changes can make a big difference in the overall organization and functionality of your closet.

Remember, the key is to create a system that works for you and your lifestyle. Don't be afraid to experiment and adjust your organization methods as needed. And don't forget to maintain your closet regularly to keep it looking its best.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm always here to help.

Good luck with your closet organization project, and I hope you enjoy your newly organized space!
